alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Houston; Inland Harris; Madison; Montgomery; Polk; San Jacinto; Walker; Waller; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 3:59PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Burleson, Grimes, Brazos, eastern Washington, western Montgomery, northwestern San Jacinto, southwestern Houston, southern Madison, northern Waller, western Polk, Walker and northwestern Harris Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 359 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Snook to near Anderson to near Willis. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... College Station, Bryan, northwestern Conroe, Huntsville, Navasota, Hempstead, Willis, Prairie View, Madisonville, Pinehurst, Washington, Hockley, Waller, Panorama Village, Magnolia, Somerville, New Waverly, Pine Island, Point Blank and Montgomery. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Houston; Inland Harris; Madison; Montgomery; Polk; San Jacinto; Walker; Waller; Washington
